FuncDef: Using the display arp speed-limit command, you can view the speed limit of Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) packets.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the slot ID of the interface board that is currently inserted.
-

Displays the speed limit bases on the destination IP address.
-

Displays the speed limit bases on the source IP address.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To identify whether the processing failure of normal ARP packets is because the rate of timestamp suppression for ARP packets is too small, causing the system unable to refresh ARP entries in time, you can run the display arp speed-limit command to view the set timestamp suppression rate for the ARP packets.
Implementation Procedure
If no slot ID is specified, the rate of timestamp suppression for ARP packets on all interface boards is displayed. If a slot number is specified, the rate of timestamp suppression for ARP packets on a specified interface board is displayed.
